strings.Value: "I've seen that you're hurting, but you didn't want to talk about it..."
"Regongar, look at me. I'm here. With you. Whatever happens."
"Suck it up! Stop sniveling! Grow some balls!"

{n}Regongar doesn't look well — he obviously didn't get much sleep last night. He stares at his feet anxiously, biting a lip he's already chewed sore.{/n} "Why am I still alive, hunh?" {n}The half-orc's voice is unusually quiet.{/n}

"{g|Technic League}The Technic League{/g} kept us in a true hell. People stronger than me were dying every day. But I survived all right. Because I wasn't alone. I had someone to survive for, you know? And now that I'm out — suddenly everything that used to keep me alive has fallen apart."

"Now I'm running around in circles like a mad dog. Unleashing on others or sinking my fangs into myself. If it wasn't for you..." {n}The half-orc bites his lip again until it bleeds.{/n} "I'd probably be dead already."

"What's there to talk about? I can't even explain to myself what's going on. I just want to drink, or die, or sit and howl like a wolf. You're the only thing that's kept me in this world, holding me almost by the collar. No one else could."

{n}The half-orc grabs you fiercely, painfully, like a drowning man grabs the side of a rescue boat. His body is shivering, and he heaves a sobbing sigh — and starts to cry, burying his face in your shoulder.{/n}
"Yes. Yes, all this time you... While I, like an idiot..." {n}Regongar's voice trembles. He steps toward you and holds you tight.{/n}

"Yes. Yes, of course. Sorry, I got droopy for a bit. Just ignore me!" {n}The half-orc smirks crookedly with his bloody lips.{/n} "All right, never mind, let's keep it moving. We don't have time to stand around chatting. — Got too many creeps to impale on our swords, ha ha!"
